example[1]: He arrived at precisely four o'clock.
example[2]: Lathes make wheels, or, more precisely, they make cylindrical objects.
example[3]: It is difficult to know precisely how much impact the changes will have.
definition[1]: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct
example[5]: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
example[6]: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
definition[2]: used to say that you agree completely with someone
example[7]: ‘It needs to be dealt with now.’ ‘Precisely, before it gets any worse.’
